Content.OneHTMLPage:
_default_ Intro Page false

This is a program that simulates a chaotic pendulum (Periodic Fourier Version).

Inverted pendulum with a vertically driven pivot is one of the less studied chaotic systems. This project models a typical Duffing's oscillator, a well-known laboratory demonstration equipment of chaotic motions. In the Lagrangian equation I used to obtain an ODE solution for such a system, however, I assumed a perfect periodic movement of the oscillator's pivot with a sine function, which is impossible in reality due to the mass and inertia of the driving spring. I have implemented this chaotic model by using Easy Java Simulation and tested its accuracy by comparing my implementation against published parameters. Then I implemented Fast Time Fourier (FFT) transformation model onto Ejs.'s Ordinary Differential Equation solver to acquire a periodically-updating power spectrum (SPD). The purpose of this study is to examine the changes in the patterns of inverted pendulum's movement, which varies back and forth from chaotic to periodic, through the lenses of Poincare analysis and Fourier transformation.

To read the detailed final report, please click on "read me" botton in the program to open up the final report.

Content.PageComment: parameters that remain constant during the motion

Variable.Name: theta
Variable.Comment: The angle formed by the string and the vertical

Variable.Name: dt
Variable.Comment: The increment for the time in each evolution step

Variable.Name: M
Variable.Comment: Poincare Parameter for Evolution Page Events

Content.PageComment: Auxiliary variables for the pendulum model

Variable.Name: PoincareIndex
Variable.Comment: Parameters of Poincare points to be shown

Variable.Name: eventIndex
Variable.Comment: Index for Pi and -Pi events in ODE events

Variable.Name: wt
Variable.Comment: Sin(w*t)'s wt used in plotting Poincare Trail

Content.PageComment: This page turns on and off each view

Variable.Name: x
Variable.Comment: x values where data is taken

Variable.Name: leftX
Variable.Comment: x values in zone to left of domain

Variable.Name: rightX
Variable.Comment: x values in zone to right of domain

Variable.Name: y
Variable.Comment: values of function corresponding to x[i] values

Variable.Name: synthesize
Variable.Comment: enables Fourier synthesis by dragging sin or cos coefficients

Variable.Name: arrowDx
Variable.Comment: x-size of arrows; always set to zero during drag

Variable.Name: arrowDrag
Variable.Comment: allows user to drag arrows (sine or cosine coefficients)

Variable.Name: arrowColor
Variable.Comment: arrow color; shows if coefficients can be dragged
